title: Beta Data Coverage
text: This index is currently in Beta with limited coverage. The 'Science' register is restricted to English and select models. Select GPT-4, to access multilingual data in the News register.

title: Methodology
text: The Lexical Alignment Score is derived from windowed prevalence analysis. It offers a fully automated metric for divergence, eliminating the need for manual curation. Details in the About section.

title: The Syntactic Fingerprint
text: A high proportion of overused terms are Function Words (e.g., connectors), suggesting that AI detection relies heavily on syntax rather than just topic. See related research.

title: Model Idiolects
text: Divergence patterns vary significantly across architectures (e.g., GPT vs. Claude), confirming that different models possess distinct idiolects. Read the analysis in Scientific American.

title: Deep Dive
text: Toggle the Table View to inspect the specific Part-of-Speech (POS) tags for every divergent word found in the dataset. OPM is occurrences per million (tokens).

title: The RLHF Effect
text: Why these words? Evidence suggests human raters during training (RLHF) often prefer this specific 'style', reinforcing the overuse of buzzwords. Listen on Science Friday.
